main_definition: Fruits can refer to the literal edible products of plants, as well as an idiomatic expression used in English language.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Literal meaning: The sweet and fleshy product of a tree or other plant that contains seeds and can be eaten by humans.
meanings_and_examples.example: Apple, banana, and strawberry are all examples of fruits.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Idiomatic expression: Used to describe the outcome of an endeavor or situation which has borne fruit in terms of success or progress.
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of hard work and dedication, her business efforts have finally begun to bear fruits.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used figuratively to refer to the results obtained from a particular action or set of actions. This can be in various contexts such as personal growth, research findings, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: The rigorous training she undertook for months finally bore fruits when she won the marathon.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In some regions or dialects, it is also used to refer to a person's achievements or rewards that are considered as fruitful results of their efforts.
meanings_and_examples.example: His dedication and hard work in his field have borne fruits; he was awarded the Nobel Prize.
